title: GBBO winner Nadiya Hussain scores her own BBC food show | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Great British Bake Off fans will be delighted to learn that former winner Nadiya Hussain is to set to follow in Mary Berry's footsteps - as she's landed her own cookery show for the BBC . Mother-of-three Nadiya, who was crowned the winner of the smash-hit baking show in 2015, will star in the eight-part series for BBC Two with the aim of seeking out the most 'quirky and clever' examples of British food. Nadiya's British Food Adventure - expected to air this summer - will see the chef tour the nation, visiting a different area in each episode of the show. Mother-of-three Nadiya, whose profile has soared since her stint on Great British Bake Off, is set to helm her own BBC series Nadiya was crowned champion of the Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood-fronted baking programme in 2015, and has since gone on to enjoy success as a baker in the media She will then return to her kitchen to recreate some of the dishes she has discovered on her travels. The 32-year-old Londoner said: 'Our country's regional cuisine is much more than tried and tested traditional dishes - there are quirky and clever food producers out there who are reinventing British food in unique and exciting ways. 'I can't wait to meet these local food heroes, to find inspiration in the most unusual food stories and unlikely ingredients and then come up with some brand new recipes in the kitchen, adding my own special twist.' 2015's GBBO champ Nadiya will tour different regions in Britain and recreate examples of their most popular dishes, adding her own 'special twist' It has just been announced that Nadiya, pictured with her husband, Adbal, will return to our screens with her own BBC show Nadia's new show will aim to seek out the most 'quirky and clever' examples of British food Nadiya explored her culinary roots in Bangladesh in a two-part television series last year. Last autumn she signed up to the BBC amid reports that Channel 4 was keen to hire her as a presenter for The Great British Bake Off when the show transfers to the broadcaster later this year. The talented chef released her first cook book, Nadiya's Kitchen, last June and also had the honour of making the Queen's 90th birthday cake.
